problem.markdown:
We're sure you've got the message by now that clean HTML is a good thing. But keeping in mind 'why' will help with future build.
>>Thinking about the learner experience, which of the following might happen if you have super messy HTML and in-line styling (rather than CSS) on a page? <<
[x] The page could take a while to load [x] Fonts could appear in different shapes and sizes within the same text block [x] Users with screenreaders might want to smash your course [ ] Learners will send you flowers in the post to say thank you
